The food has ten times the flavor than the Filibertos across the street does. Don't even try to compare the two, Los Betos is twenty times better. Their food is much more authentic, so if you're looking for real Mexican flavors I recommend this place. I will say, don't expect high quality, best-Mexican-I've-ever-had food; its not gonna happen here. However, its fast, convenient, and the closest place where I can get GOOD burritos (I've had so many that have tasted like cardboard its ridiculous... Ahhem, Filibertos). 

I recommend the "California" burrito, by far my favorite. Or the "pastor" burrito. Also, the carne asada is very good and if you want something cheap but filling they have 5 tacos for $5.95 I think and they're pretty good too. Also, if you want the carne asada fries but aren't sure if it'll be worth the $10, let me tell you it is, they're big, delicious, and smell divine. 

The service is also the best. I love coming and talking to the people who work there, always friendly and know how to make you smile. Oh and if you ask for pickled jalapeños (in Spanish they're called jalapeños en vinagre) they will also provide them (free of charge). 

It's a local business, so you can't feel bad for spending your money here. 

Happy eating
Excellent dive for burritos.  No indoor seating.  Would go back again.  Reasonably priced.

I'm the kind of gal that needs greasy, cheesy, spicy, yummy goodness after a rough night out.
Los betos has been my go to spot for the right kind of cure.
My favorite burrito is the California burrito, no pico de gallo, add beans. I order this every time and it does it's trick.
I recommend you get this burrito and you'll never go back to a different kind of burrito.

Breakfast burritos all day, 'er day! 

It's delish. You will not be disappointed. If you are not acclimated to hot sauces, I would suggest you NOT put the red sauce inside the burrito. 

The red and green sauce are AUHMAZIN' though. 

All I can say is... don't judge a book by its cover. Pull on up to the drive thru and experience some mouth watering breakfast burritos (they have other items on their menu) 24/7.

Breakfast burritos long enough to make a porn star go DAMN...

This unassuming drive through houses some legit burritos. I have had both the bacon and egg burrito, and the carne asada. While the carne asada one doesn't keep pace with burritos I got back in SD, the bacon and egg is seriously tasty. Extra large tortillas stuffed and wrapped correctly, it literally is enough for two meals.  Their salsas are decent as well. 

While it may not get a Michelen star anytime soon, they have an A health inspection sign proudly posted, and drive through service is quick and efficient. It will easily be a choice when I'm running late or too tired to make my own breakfast in the morning!
this place sucks. meat tastes like straight asshole!

Im not sure what kind of person checks yelp for a Mexican fast food joint with a drive thru  - usually best for after the bar closes. It's what you would expect. Greasy, filling, sauce laden, cheese covered Mexican food in a styrofoam box.
75% of the menu comes out of a deep fryer - these places are on every corner in Scottsdale and are pretty much the same. Not as cheap as they should be but they are sure to fill you up. 
Seriously - how do you review 5 rolled tacos with cheese...

We absolutely love Los Betos!  We have always been treated well and the food is always hot and fresh!  We have breakfast from here at least once a week and it's also our late night snack place!  The breakfast burritos are big enough for 2 people, and the tacos are always stuffed too!  The tortas are also outta this world!  Never get sick from it like other places either!

I have been coming to this place for over five years now, it is heaven on earth. 

I have tried majority of items on the menu and they are all delicious. 

Moreover, the people who works there are super nice. 

More importantly they are open 24/7

So one day for lunch I was craving a burrito. This location is across the street from a filibertos so I was kinda in limbo of which one to go to. After reading a few reviews I decided Los Betos. I honestly do not know why I punish my stomach during work hours with fast food burritos. Anyhoo, I ordered the California burrito with a bit of sour cream. I also asked for some salsa. 

The Burrito was mostly tortilla and potato... I was pretty upset at the fact I wasted money on this thing. The crappy made and carb burrito was decent and let's be honest with each other.... I asked for this, I Damn well knew this was gonna happen. If your looking for a bomb burrito, dont visit a fast food chain ending in betos!

Let me start by saying this place could potentially kill someone. That's alright with me ;)

Great if you want a huge greasy breakfast burrito, or a clogged artery. Either way, they're open 24 hours a day, and they're quick to get your order out.

I got the chips (plain), and a sausage breakfast burrito to go with the cocktail I made at home. I got through about half of that burrito and was stuffed to the brim. These things are pretty large, but don't let the previous reviews hype up the size. It was a good 12 inches long, and almost 3 inches in diameter. Packed with cheese, sausage, and eggs. My boyfriend ordered the chrizo and told me the chrizo was a bit over cooked (figured maybe they used left overs from the day before) and he would have liked a little more egg in there. It was a good pound of pure chrizo and maybe 1 scrambled egg total in that thing.

Nobody got sick.

After my breakfast burrito sat in the fridge for 30 minutes and I pulled it back out for a few more bites, it wasn't worth eating. All the grease formed solid, so I trashed it.

I'd go back again. Maybe next time I'll clog my arteries with cardne asada tacos.

PS: The chips aren't that great. But cocktails make everything delicious.

2 stars goes to food quality
1 star goes to it being open 24 hours

Vegetarians Beware
Two days ago we ordered 2 potato, egg, cheese & bean burritos & 1 bean tostada. When we got home, 1 burrito had no beans & the other had a bunch of meat. I called & some man told me I could come back the following day & said he'd take care of it. We couldn't return until 2 days later & got nothing because I didn't get a receipt that night and he did not leave a note (after waiting 5 minutes while the woman checked.) She would not rectify the problem so that's the end of our 15 year Los Betos history. I'll just make the short extra trip to Fiesta Burrito on McDowell, between Miller Rd & Scottsdale Rd. It's better anyway!
